sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"乐曲，曲调"之意。
means: melody ： 指悦耳的曲调旋律。
song ： 多指配有歌词的歌曲。
tune ： 指曲调，与配有歌词的歌曲相对。

sentence.Network_en: It was just an ordinary voice, but he sang in tune.
sentence.Network_cn: 他声音很一般，但唱得都在调子上。

sentence.Network_en: More than six million youngsters tune in to Blockbusters every day.
sentence.Network_cn: 每天有600多万年轻人收看“热门大片”这档节目。

sentence.Network_en: Today, his change of direction seems more in tune with the times.
sentence.Network_cn: 今天，他方向的改变似乎更与时代合拍。

对于孩子们的尖叫不予理睬

jx.jx_en_mean: To adjust a machine so as to put it into proper condition.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 调节（机器等）：调整机器使其处于正常的工作状态

jx.jx_en_mean: To prepare (oneself) for a specified activity.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 热身，准备活动：为某一特殊活动做准备

jx.jx_en_mean: To the sum or extent of

lj.lj_ly: produced profits to the tune of about $20 million.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: unexplained alteration of tone. The verb is first recorded (late 15th cent.) in the sense 'celebrate in music, sing'

entry.def: A tune is a series of musical notes that is pleasant and easy to remember.

example.ex: She was humming a merry little tune.
example.tran: 她正哼着一支欢快的小调。

entry.def: You can refer to a song or a short piece of music as a tune .

example.ex: She'll also be playing your favourite pop tunes.
example.tran: 她还将演奏你最喜欢的流行乐曲。

entry.def: When someone tunes a musical instrument, they adjust it so that it produces the right notes.

example.ex: 'We do tune our guitars before we go on,' he insisted.
example.tran: “我们在演奏以前确实会为吉他调音，”他坚持说道。

entry.tran: 调试，调整(发动机或机器)
entry.def: When an engine or machine is tuned, it is adjusted so that it works well.

example.ex: Drivers are urged to make sure that car engines are properly tuned.
example.tran: 司机们被敦促要确保汽车发动机调试妥当。

entry.def: If your radio or television is tuned to a particular broadcasting station, you are listening to or watching the programmes being broadcast by that station.

example.ex: A small colour television was tuned to an afternoon soap opera.
example.tran: 一台小彩色电视机频道调在了一出下午的肥皂剧上。

entry.def: If you say that a person or organization is calling the tune, you mean that they are in a position of power or control in a particular situation.

example.ex: Who would then be calling the tune in Parliament?

entry.tran: 改变调子;变卦;改变态度
entry.def: If you say that someone has changed their tune, you are criticizing them because they have changed their opinion or way of doing things.

example.ex: You've changed your tune since this morning, haven't you?...
example.tran: 你从今天早上就变卦了，是不是？

example.ex: Yesterday he changed his tune, saying the fare increase was experimental.
example.tran: 昨天他变卦了，说提价只是试行。

entry.tran: 被…牵着鼻子走;受…的控制
entry.def: If you say that someone is dancing to someone else's tune, you mean that they are allowing themselves to be controlled by the other person.

example.ex: The danger of commercialism is that the churches end up dancing to the tune of their big business sponsors.
example.tran: 商业主义的危险就是教会最终可能会被大赞助商牵着鼻子走。

entry.tran: 合调的/走调的;在调子上/不在调子上
entry.def: A person or musical instrument that is in tune produces exactly the right notes. A person or musical instrument that is out of tune does not produce exactly the right notes.

example.ex: It was just an ordinary voice, but he sang in tune...
example.tran: 他声音很一般，但唱得都在调子上。

example.ex: Many of the notes are out of tune...

entry.tran: 一致/不一致;赞同/不赞同
entry.def: If you are in tune with a group of people, you are in agreement or sympathy with them. If you are out of tune with them, you are not in agreement or sympathy with them.

example.ex: Today, his change of direction seems more in tune with the times...
example.tran: 今天，他方向的改变似乎更与时代合拍。

example.ex: The peace campaigners were probably out of tune with most Britons.
example.tran: 和平倡导者可能不被大部分英国人认同。

entry.def: To the tune of a particular amount of money means to the extent of that amount.

example.ex: They've been sponsoring the World Cup to the tune of a million and a half pounds.
example.tran: 他们已经对世界杯提供了高达 150 万英镑的赞助费。

means.word_mean: 1. a succession of notes forming a distinctive sequence;

sentences.sentence: "she was humming an air from Beethoven"

means.word_mean: 2. the property of producing accurately a note of a given pitch;
3. the adjustment of a radio receiver or other circuit to a required frequency

list.explanation: (反主流文化用语)识时务，赶潮流，跟上时代

example.en: Hey, Jill! You shoutd tune in! Why don't you?
example.zh: 嗨，吉尔!你应该赶上潮流!为什么不呢？

Sentence.sentence: Were they tuned off because an American had the nerve to instruct Japanese in their own art form or they deliberately tried to signal their rejection of her?
He uses cheap guitars that won't stay in shape or in tune.
Were they tuned off because an American had the nerve to instruct Japanese in their own art form or they deliberately tried to signal their rejection of her?

sentences.en: The violin and the piano seem to be out of tune.
sentences.cn: 钢琴和小提琴好像不合调。
乐队调好了他们的乐器。

sentences.en: How long has it been since you've had a mechanic tune this engine?
sentences.cn: 你已经有多长时间没请汽车修理工调整这台引擎了?

jushi.chinese: 他唱了一个快乐的调子。

jushi.english: The violin and the piano seem to be out of tune.
jushi.chinese: 钢琴和小提琴好像不合调。

jushi.english: He is in tune with his company.
jushi.chinese: 他和他的同伴相处融洽。
